Trait.Name: Abrasive
Trait.Description: The character rubs people the wrong way. This gives them trouble when trying to make Ego checks to persuade someone to help them out. It gives them an edge when they are trying to make Ego checks to intimidate someone.

Trait.Name: Anathema
Trait.Description: The character suffers direct harm when exposed to a particular substance. They cannot voluntarily enter the same space with it. If they are touched by it, they instantly suffer the damage of a Rank 3 attack roll that automatically succeeds. This continues each turn until they are separated from the substance or are killed or destroyed. Damage caused by Anathema ignores all damage reduction the character has and cannot be healed by their Healing Factor.

Trait.Name: Audience
Trait.Description: Many people follow the character's work and treat them with the respect they deserve. By making an Ego check, the character can persuade their audience to provide help in the form of information or resources. The Narrator determines the TN of the Ego check based on the favor requested.

Trait.Name: Battle Ready
Trait.Description: The character is always mentally prepared for any sort of trouble to start. Add +30 Focus.

Trait.Name: Beguiling
Trait.Description: The character has an edge when making an Ego check to persuade someone who could be attracted to them.

Trait.Name: Berserker
Trait.Description: The character often loses control of their temper. Any time they take physical damage, they must make an Ego check with a TN equal to the amount of damage done. If they fail, they go berserk and must charge at full speed into combat with the enemy who hurt them. Being berserk gives the character an edge on all close attacks and adds +2 to their Melee, Resilience and Ego defenses. However, it takes -2 from their Agility defense, and they cannot use ranged weapons. At the end of their turn, they lose 5 Focus. When Focus is too low or no enemies are in sight, berserk ends.

Trait.Name: Big
Trait.Description: The character's size is big, which applies -1 to their Melee and Agility defenses, adds +1 to their Run Speed, and increases their reach to 2. They still occupy a single space.
Trait.statAdjust: add:Melee Defence Score;-1,add:Agility Defence Score;-1,add:Combat Run Speed;1,add:Run Speed;1

Trait.Name: Bloodthirsty
Trait.Description: The character likes hurting people—even killing them. After they knock someone unconscious, they must make a Challenging Ego check to keep from continuing to attack them until they're dead. A character with this trait cannot take the Heroic tag.

Trait.Name: Breathe Different
Trait.Description: The character cannot breathe Earth's air for long. They lose 1 point of Health for every minute they do not have some sort of assistance to allow them to breathe properly.

Trait.Name: Clinician
Trait.Description: The character has an edge on Logic checks to determine what is medically wrong with someone they examine.

Trait.Name: Clueless
Trait.Description: The character tends to shut out things they're not entirely focused on. They have trouble on any Vigilance checks to spot hidden or invisible things. Enemies have an edge on Agility checks to sneak near or past them.

Trait.Name: Combat Expert
Trait.Description: The character knows how to handle themselves better than most. They have an edge on Melee attacks against enemies of Rank 1.

Trait.Name: Combat Reflexes
Trait.Description: The character can react quickly in combat. This grants them one additional reaction each turn.

Trait.Name: Connections
Trait.Description: The character knows someone with access to and knowledge of a particular field. The contact could be a reporter, police officer, politician, mobster, etc. By making an Ego check, the character can call on their contact to provide help in the form of clues, information or resources. This trait can be selected multiple times, using types like Celebrities, Community, Criminal, Espionage, Military, Outsiders, Police, Professional, Sources, Super Heroes, etc.

Trait.Name: Dealmaker
Trait.Description: The character is skilled at negotiation. They have an edge on action checks related to making deals.

Trait.Name: Determination
Trait.Description: The character never gives up, even when they feel like they're at their worst. While demoralized, they do not gain trouble on all actions, though they still cannot maintain concentration or spend further Focus.

Trait.Name: Eidetic Memory
Trait.Description: The character rarely forgets anything. If their player forgets something, they can ask the Narrator to remind them.

Trait.Name: Enduring Constitution
Trait.Description: The character can function for up to 48 hours without sleep and has an edge on Resilience checks to overcome fatigue or weariness.

Trait.Name: Enhanced Physique
Trait.Description: The character is stronger than regular humans. Treat them as one size bigger for lifting, carrying, swinging and throwing things. (This does not stack with other factors.)

Trait.Name: Extra Occupation
Trait.Description: The character has a busy life and has done all sorts of things. They can choose another occupation.

Trait.Name: Extraordinary Origin
Trait.Description: The character has an additional origin. This trait can be selected multiple times, but each time must be cleared with the Narrator. Take care to ensure origins make sense combined.

Trait.Name: Famous
Trait.Description: The character is widely known—at least among a certain group or population. They may be liked or hated, but are famous. They have an edge when making Ego checks to persuade someone who thinks favorably of them, and trouble when persuading those who dislike them. If the character has a secret identity, this trait works for only one of their identities but can be taken multiple times for multiple identities.

Trait.Name: Fearless
Trait.Description: The character is extremely brave. They have an edge on any action checks required to deal with fear.

Trait.Name: First Aid
Trait.Description: The character knows how to administer first aid. They have an edge on Logic checks to stop bleeding.

Trait.Name: Font of Information
Trait.Description: The character has an edge on Logic checks related to knowledge.

Trait.Name: Free Running
Trait.Description: The character has an edge on Agility checks made to perform acrobatics during a movement action.

Trait.Name: Fresh Eyes
Trait.Description: The character has their own way of doing things. Often makes them seem strange, but brings new perspectives. They have an edge on Logic checks faced with something for the first time.

Trait.Name: Gearhead
Trait.Description: The character knows their way around machines. They have an edge on Logic checks to figure out how machines work.

Trait.Name: Glibness
Trait.Description: The character can strike up conversation with anyone and can often convince them to lend a hand. Edge on Ego checks to persuade characters they are speaking to for the first time.

Trait.Name: God Heritage
Trait.Description: The character—or at least one ancestor—is a god. Pick what they are god of, including new gods not claimed by others. Other gods may be jealous. The character has an edge dealing with something they are god of. Restriction: Only selectable by characters with mythic origin attached to a particular pantheon (e.g., Asgardian or Olympian).
Trait.Restrictions: For mythic origin with pantheon only

Trait.Name: Gullible
Trait.Description: The character is easy to fool. People lying to them have an edge on their Ego checks to persuade the character of something.

Trait.Name: Honest
Trait.Description: The character is a terrible liar. They have trouble any time they make an Ego check that involves telling a lie. However, they have an edge on any friendly Ego (persuasion) checks in which they're truthful.

Trait.Name: Interrogation
Trait.Description: The character knows how to ask the right questions in the right way. They have an edge on Ego or Logic checks made when asking questions.

Trait.Name: Inventor
Trait.Description: The character is good at coming up with solutions on the fly. They have an edge on Logic checks when creating or repairing things.

Trait.Name: Investigation
Trait.Description: The character is an expert investigator. They have an edge on Vigilance checks to spot clues and on Logic checks related to interpreting clues. If they have access to a forensics lab at the time, they gain a second edge on such checks.

Trait.Name: Iron Will
Trait.Description: Enemies have trouble on Ego attacks to control the character's mind or influence their behavior. Also, the character gains an edge on Ego checks to break free of mind control or other compulsions.

Trait.Name: Legal Eagle
Trait.Description: The character knows the laws of their homeland and can help others navigate them. They have an edge on Logic checks when dealing with legalities.

Trait.Name: Leverage
Trait.Description: The character is good at figuring out what people want and using it against them. They have an edge on Logic checks to investigate people and on Ego checks to persuade people they've investigated.

Trait.Name: Loner
Trait.Description: The character does not play well with others. They cannot be given an edge via assistance by someone who is not a teammate.

Trait.Name: Monster
Trait.Description: The character is some kind of monster, often of a type spoken of in legend. They have an edge whenever they attempt to intimidate someone.

Trait.Name: Out of Shape
Trait.Description: The character is in poor physical condition. They are considered one size smaller for the purposes of lifting, carrying, swinging and throwing things.

Trait.Name: Piloting
Trait.Description: The character knows how to operate vehicles of all kinds. They have an edge on Agility checks triggered when piloting or driving a vehicle during a movement action. This applies to cars, boats, aircraft and so on.

Trait.Name: Presence
Trait.Description: The character knows how to command attention on demand. They have an edge on Ego checks that involve getting people to pay attention to them or to voluntarily do things for them.

Trait.Name: Public Speaking
Trait.Description: The character knows how to get the attention of a crowd, whether that's at a political rally or in front of a jury or a classroom. They have an edge on Ego checks when attempting to persuade groups.

Trait.Name: Pundit
Trait.Description: The character knows how to break news items and put them into context to craft a story around them. They have an edge on Ego or Logic rolls made when giving their opinion via media.

Trait.Name: Quick Learner
Trait.Description: If the character fails an action check, they gain an edge on the check if they try the same action again on their next turn.

Trait.Name: Scientific Expertise
Trait.Description: The character has extensive scientific training. They have an edge on Logic checks made when dealing with scientific research. If they have access to an appropriate lab at the time, they gain a second edge on such checks.

Trait.Name: Signature Attack
Trait.Description: The character is known for favoring a particular kind of weapon or attack power. They have an edge when making attacks that way. This trait can be taken more than once, but each time must be with a different kind of weapon or attack power.

Trait.Name: Situational Awareness
Trait.Description: The character is trained to always keep an eye out. They have an edge on initiative checks.

Trait.Name: Skeptical
Trait.Description: The character is hard to fool. People lying to them have trouble on their Ego checks to persuade the character of something.

Trait.Name: Small
Trait.Description: The character's size is small, which adds to their Melee and Agility defenses and takes -1 from their Run Speed.
Trait.statAdjust: add:Melee Defence Score;1,add:Agility Defence Score;1,add:Combat Run Speed;-1,add:Run Speed;-1

Trait.Name: Sneaky
Trait.Description: The character has an edge on Agility checks when sneaking around. Enemies have trouble on Vigilance checks to detect the character when the character is invisible or hiding.

Trait.Name: Stranger
Trait.Description: The character doesn't understand local customs. They have trouble on checks made when trying to decipher such things or when trying to pass themselves off as a local.

Trait.Name: Surprising Power
Trait.Description: The character can choose a power they normally wouldn't be able to use. The character will still need to have any prerequisite powers, but they can ignore rank and origin requirements. This trait can be selected multiple times.

Trait.Name: Tech Reliance
Trait.Description: The character relies on technology for powers. When they take damage that would render them unconscious, they can instead choose to lose all of their technology-related powers and remain conscious with 1 point of Health remaining. Assuming the character has access to parts and tools, lost powers can be repaired after a battle.

Trait.Name: Weakness
Trait.Description: The character suffers an unusual amount of harm from certain substances. Any attack made with that substance ignores all inherent damage reduction the character has and cannot be healed by their Healing Factor.

Trait.Name: Weird
Trait.Description: The character has something weird (or even wonderful) about them. This causes people to have strong reactions to them, both good and bad. They have an edge on all Ego checks to persuade people inclined to like them and trouble on all Ego checks against people inclined to dislike them.

Trait.Name: Hive Mind
Trait.Description: The character has some independence but is connected to others of their kind by a telepathic network with an unlimited range and an unlimited number of members. When given orders by the leader of that network, the character must make an Ego vs. TN 18 action check or follow those orders. On a Fantastic success, the character can choose to permanently break free from the network.

Trait.Name: Magic Item Reliance
Trait.Description: The character relies on a magically empowered item for some or all of their powers. When they take Health damage that would render them unconscious, they can instead choose to lose all of their magic-item-related powers and remain conscious with 1 point of Health left. Similarly, if they take Focus damage that would render them demoralized, they can instead choose to lose all of their powers and have 1 point of Focus left. Magic items are notoriously difficult to destroy, cannot be harmed by most attacks, but can be taken away or lost.

Trait.Name: Suspicious
Trait.Description: The character is naturally suspicious of people who are hiding something. When someone with a secret identity makes a Logic check to try to convince the character that they're mistaken about the secret identity, the character gives them trouble.

Trait.Name: Symbiotic Spider-Blinder
Trait.Description: While the character is bonded to a symbiote, they cannot be detected by the Spider-Sense of any character who was previously bonded to the same symbiote. This effect is passed on to the symbiote's offspring as well. Example: Spider-Man (Peter Parker) was once bonded to the Venom symbiote, so his Spider-Sense cannot detect Venom or anyone bonded with it, including offspring like Carnage.

Trait.Name: External Awareness
Trait.Description: The character has a telepathic link with all other Externals. This allows them to know where other Externals are, know when other Externals are first killed, know when an External kills another External, and telepathically call for other Externals.

Trait.Name: Infector
Trait.Description: The character can infect a target with a disease, which must be chosen along with the trait. Examples include implantation, Techno-Organic virus, and Transmode virus. See infected condition (p. 139) for details about how infection works and the Infections and Possessions section (p. 146) for the effects of the above diseases.

Trait.Name: Unusual Size
Trait.Description: The character's regular size is beyond those for small, average, or big, as shown on the Resize Effects table (see p. 73 of the Core Rulebook). When picking this trait, the player must choose the character's size: microscopic, miniature, tiny, little, gigantic, titanic or gargantuan. Apply modifiers listed on the Resize Effects table, just as if the character had grown or shrunk to that size, but permanently. Flight Speed exceptions apply as in the original text.

Trait.Name: Venomous
Trait.Description: When the character uses sharp Melee Weapon powers and gets a Fantastic success, they have the option of causing target to be poisoned rather than bleeding.
